metadata.title: CVE-2023-46045 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Graphviz 2.36.0 through 9.x before 10.0.1 has an out-of-bounds read via acrafted config6a file. NOTE: exploitability may be uncommon because thisfile is typically owned by root.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-46045` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphviz - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
libcdt5 - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
libcgraph6 - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
libgv-guile - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
libgv-lua - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
libgv-perl - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
libgv-ruby - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
libgv-tcl - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
libgvc6 - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
libgvc6-plugins-gtk - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
libgvpr2 - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
liblab-gamut1 - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpathplan4 - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
libxdot4 - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
python3-gv - 2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphviz package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.42.2-6ubuntu0.1+esm1').
